sentence: I’m a boots-on-the-ground, actual cop.” As McCarthy and his allies weigh Katko’s successor on the committee, they can look to one prominent example of a Freedom Caucus member who came into their fold: Rep. Jim Jordan (R-Ohio), a co-founder of the famously combative group.
title: Freedom Caucus members square off for a plum post with all eyes on McCarthy

title: Freedom Caucus members square off for a plum post with all eyes on McCarthy

sentence: I respect that.” Bishop, who is also a member of the Judiciary Committee and good friends with ranking member Rep. Jim Jordan (R-OH), noted there is a “particular logic that makes sense” in the possibility of him chairing Homeland.
author: Ashley Oliver
title: Exclusive: Freedom Caucus Members Jostle for Top Post on Immigration Oversight Panel

sentence: The top Republicans on four House committees are questioning the Biden administration‘s decision to “prematurely release” a Russian cybercriminal, raising concerns that “he may now be working against U.S. interests.” Reps. Jim Jordan and Michael Turner, both of Ohio, and Reps. John Katko of New York and Michael McCaul of Texas fired off a letter Monday to White House National Security Adviser Jake Sullivan asking for more information as to why the administration granted Aleksei Burkov early release from U.S. custody.
author: Seth McLaughlin
title: Republicans raise questions about U.S. release of Russian cybercriminal

sentence: Judiciary Committee Ranking Member Jim Jordan (R-Ohio), Intelligence Committee Ranking Member Michael Turner (R-Ohio), Homeland Security Committee Ranking Member John Katko (R-N.Y.), and Foreign Affairs Committee Ranking Member Michael McCaul (R-Texas), sent a letter to Joe Biden’s National Security Advisor Jake Sullivan looking for answers.
author: Matt Margolis
title: Biden Released a Top Russian Hacker, and Republicans Have Questions
